name: Turbo Outrun clone
description:
Choose one of the two most desirable 80's sports cars and blast your way through 9 stages within the time limit... twice!
Everytime you complete a stage you'll get extra time to reach the end of the next one. Failing to do so will make the car slow down. If you're lucky, you can still reach the checkpoint. On your way you'll encounter many other cars. I suggest you try not to hit them.
Completing all stages will earn you absolutely nothing, except the sense of accomplishment.

The time limit is pretty tight. Make thoughtful use of the turbo boost which will pretty much double the torque output of your fancy prancing horse. Don't use it too much, because your temperature gauge will rise pretty quickly. Choose the auto transmission or the 2 speed to get a more forgiving time limit.

The car is controlled with the arrow keys (sorry, no aswd controls), but an Xbox controller is highly recommended.

KeyboardXbox controllerThrottle:UPRight triggerBrake:DOWNLeft triggerSteering:LEFT & RIGHTLeft joystickUpshift:Q (or A maybe?)A buttonDownshift:W (or Z maybe?)X buttonTurbo boost:SPACEY buttonManual clutch:Right joystick down

This game is a work in progress. Well, should be. I wanted to make this prototype prettier, but my hard drive with all the game files on it failed. Retrieving the data will cost me around €1000. All donations will be used to fund the retrieval of the data on that hard drive, so I can continue developing this game.

Wonder why there are a lot of bus signs? Well, this game was supposed to be a Desert Bus remake. And when I changed my mind, this sign was the only sprite I had to put next to the road and it never left.
